patient_summary: This patient is a 56-year-old man who was admitted to the hospital for nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. He was diagnosed with acute gastroenteritis and gastrointestinal bleed. He was treated with IV fluids and then a clear liquid diet, which he tolerated well. He was also started on prednisone. He is now being discharged home with instructions to take a tapered dose of prednisone for four weeks and to follow up with his GI doctor in four weeks.
